name: Beginner Warmup
description: A 15-minute warmup routine covering stretches, chromatic exercises, and basic chord shapes.

steps.name: Hand Stretches
steps.instructions: Stretch your fingers, wrists, and forearms. Spread your fingers wide, then make fists. Roll your wrists in circles.
steps.notes: Never skip stretching. Cold hands lead to injury.

steps.name: Chromatic Exercise — Frets 1-4
steps.instructions: Play 1-2-3-4 on each string, starting from the low E string. Use one finger per fret. Focus on clean fretting and even timing.
steps.notes: Keep your thumb behind the neck, fingers curved.

steps.name: Open Chord Shapes — G, C, D
steps.instructions: Cycle through G major, C major, and D major chords. Strum each chord 4 times, then switch. Focus on clean transitions.

steps.name: Single String Picking
steps.instructions: Pick each open string individually, alternating between downstrokes and upstrokes. Focus on consistent tone and volume.
steps.notes: Alternate picking is fundamental — build the habit now.

steps.name: Cool Down
steps.instructions: Play anything you enjoy for a few minutes. Noodle, strum, or just relax. Shake out your hands when done.
steps.notes: End every session on a positive note.
